file_content.text: Tatooine's a safer place, thanks to you. The shadow of Sith won't cross here.
Galen. I've done all I can to help the locals.
That's what I keep hearing.
Mayor Airen says her outpost's reopened for trade. She's got visitors from as far as Mos Maran, talking and working together.
There are farmers who aren't afraid of Sand People anymore, militiamen you inspired... you've given Tatooine a reason to fight.
You said if I did this, Tatooine could stop an Imperial takeover.
What about the Empire?
The people who live here did the real work. I just lent a hand.
I didn't do anything notable.
That's all anyone really needs.
I could be on Coruscant or Alderaan right now. Instead, I've been risking my life for nobodies.
I've been helping idiots.
Who would you rather be risking your life for?
We'll never be strong enough to beat the Empire, but united, we can convince them we're too much trouble to conquer.
Now get out of here before another sandstorm hits. If you can save Tatooine in a day, I imagine the galaxy needs you.
Now get out of here before another sandstorm hits. I imagine Darth Angral won't wait much longer.
If I fail at my mission, everything I did here will mean nothing. Tatooine will fall along with many other worlds.
My duties come first, true.
Now get out of here before another sandstorm hits. I imagine those lost Masters you're after can't wait anymore.
The Force itself seems troubled by what I face. But I must prevail.
My duties won't be easy.
You'll do what the Force requires of you. I can sense that much.
Now get out of here before another sandstorm hits. You must be eager to stop those traitors.
I follow my orders and serve the Republic. That's all I ask.
I'm just a dutiful soldier.
The Force will provide.
Now get out of here before another sandstorm hits. The treasure hunt can't wait, can it?
It's time I got a real answer. Who are you, and how do you know about me?
All right--who are you really?
I suppose I owe you that much.
Some Jedi boldly save worlds. Others fight empires. And some put their lightsabers aside and help in smaller ways.
No offense, but I barely broke even here. I've got to start turning a profit.
Time to make some money.
You will, someday--but the Force will guide you to interesting places.
Wipe that smirk off your face. When you're dead and buried, I'll have the Republic eating out of my hand.
Go away, old man.
When I'm dead and buried, I'll know I tried my best.
Go on. We won't meet again--and though this planet won't remember you, what you've done will change it forever.
If you don't save that outpost, no one else will.
Get your boy inside. We've got ten minutes before the wind picks up.
What about Chesla?
She's not stupid, she'll be here--just go!
You should get inside, too--there's a sandstorm coming, and the spaceport's a designated shelter. No flights in or out for a while.
You can't get word out to everyone yourself. I'll bring people back--just keep the shelter open.
My duty's to help, not hide.
The Force can be a beacon in a storm. I can help those who're lost find their way here.
I volunteer to assist.
I'd expect that from a Jedi. All right, but we lock down in twenty. Move!
I appreciate the advice, but I don't like sitting around. Let me sweep the town, I'll find anyone left behind.
I'll make sure everyone's in.
Good to see the Republic has a heart. Now move.
Rough flying doesn't scare me. Why don't I grab a speeder, shuttle people back here before the storm hits?
I can lend a hand.
You're a lifesaver, Captain. Just get yourself inside before we lock down!
We've done all we can. Now we wait.
I've been on Tatooine awhile, and I haven't seen any storms.
Are sandstorms common?
They mostly die out crossing the Jundland Wastes, but when they hit, they hit hard.
I'll take my chances. My ship is tough.
No way I'm staying here.
Not that tough. Besides, hangars are already sealed--you'll have to wait things out like everyone else.
Galen! Dozen more from the farmsteads coming in!
Guess we'll make room. Come on, they'll stay out of your way....
We'll be buried alive in here.
You'll be just fine. Don't worry.
Looks like we got out okay--pretty much everyone did, though we lost three power generators.
Guess that's not exciting next to flying around the galaxy, fighting Imperials on Nar Shaddaa and whatnot.
Doesn't compare to fighting--what was it, some Sith Lord causing groundquakes in the desert?
Doesn't compare to tracking down some crazed Jedi Master, I suppose.
Doesn't compare to stopping the "mad bomber of Anchorhead" and his Imperial cronies, but what does?
Not that it compares to the excitement of chasing Jedi and Sith, meeting big-time gangsters....
You're very well informed, for a--what did you say your job was?
How do you know about me?
Name's Galen. I'm just a man enjoying his retirement, trying to give something back to the community.
I deal with my share of violence, but I don't look down on people who aren't fighting for their lives.
It's not all about excitement.
Not even a little bit?
My business is private.
Of course--I'm pushing my luck keeping you here, I know.
Look, these people have it rough in the best of times, but between pirates and sandstorms and Sand People... we can't take much more.
If you leave without finishing the job you started, how long before the Empire claims this planet?
You're asking me to stay--but I've done what I came for.
"The job I started"?
And along the way, you helped out all sorts of people; would it hurt to focus on that, for once?
Tatooine isn't a threat or a strategic asset. I wouldn't worry about the Empire.
The Empire won't bother you.
The Empire's already here! Digging up dirt, testing bombs... they've got a garrison in Mos Ila.
I wouldn't worry. The Empire won't be bothering you anymore.
I took care of the Imperials.
I'm grateful for what you did, but we both know they're still out there.
Tatooine isn't part of the Republic, and your fate isn't my concern.
That isn't my problem.
No one's paying me to babysit this planet. What goes on here is up to you.
I don't really care.
You've helped us out already--I'm only asking for a day or two more.
Tatooine's only chance is unity--making communities that can stand together against warlords and monsters.
Espelar's our best hope--it's a trading post where farmers, Jawas and leaders from half a dozen towns swap information. The Empire means to burn it to the ground.
How will the Empire "burn it to the ground"?
Tell me about the threat.
I'm sure Espelar is important to Tatooine, but I can't see why the Empire would care.
Why would one outpost matter?
With a strong trade outpost, there's strong community and strong resistance. Without....
You can't be serious.
I've got pals in the militia, all sorts of places; I'm asking you to trust me.
Sandstorm broke Espelar's defenses, and the Imperials will send in saboteurs. You need to give the people breathing room, help them rebuild.
Stop the Imperials, head into town and help put this planet on the path to being a proud, independent society. Or give up and go--your choice.
There's nothing I can do for you, I'm afraid.
